content.text: Not to be confused with Kashi, one of the two giant gatekeepers for Enies Lobby.
Kashigami was the grandparent of Nola. It was thought to be a god by the Shandia.
It looked almost exactly the same as Nola, but was a bit smaller. All other traits are exactly the same as its grandchild.
Little was known about Kashigami’s personality, but it seemed to have an instinctual mindset, accepting people as sacrifices, or, in its mind, food.
Kashigami had a child whose name is unknown before its death. It first appeared in Chapter 289 and Episode 188.

When it was first seen, it was smaller than its parent. It approached a trapped Noland, after finishing off a leopard it had just killed. Kalgara declared this was Noland's punishment for killing their god. After a speech on the cure for Tree Fever, Kalgara took it upon himself to kill it to protect Noland. Before this child was killed, however, it sired a child of its own, Nola.
When it first appeared in the story, Kalgara's daughter was about to be sacrificed to it, when Mont Blanc Noland defeated it.

elements.text: Although the serpent was labeled "Kashigami", some Shandorians themselves did not know what their God looked like until it appeared. This indicates that the ritual was not a common occurrence amongst their people and was something they reserved only for dire situations.
↑  One Piece Blue Deep: Characters World (p. 44), Kashigami's birthday is given.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 31 Chapter 289 and Episode 188, The snake is killed by Kalgara.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 31 Chapter 287 and Episode 187, Kashigami approaches to kill and then is killed itself by Noland.
